channel.title: Need help once more
channel.description:
Once again, I'm having a problem with my funpk command to turn it off and on. Here is the problem; when I try to turn funpk off via command, it only applys for the person that trys to turn it off and everyone else isn't effected. How can I make it so everyone is effected and cannot kill people in there once its turned off?
Thanks. REP++

item.title: Need help once more
item.dc:creator: @Ill_Pk_You Ill Pk You
item.description:
@Ill_Pk_You wrote:

That’s what I need help with, and that code was outdated. Here is new one:

public boolean inFunPk() { if (absX >= 3331 && absX <= 3359 && absY >= 3243 && absY <= 3259 && FunPk == true) { return true; } else { return false; }

Read full topic

item.title: Need help once more
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

public boolean inFunPk() { if (absX >= 3331 && absX <= 3359 && absY >= 3243 && absY <= 3259) { return true; } return false; }
Just looks neater.

I think your command would only turn FunPK on/off for the admin that does it. Try making it for everyone.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help once more
item.dc:creator: @Ill_Pk_You Ill Pk You
item.description:
@Ill_Pk_You wrote:

Wouldn’t this be ok though?:

public boolean inFunPk() { if (absX >= 3331 && absX <= 3359 && absY >= 3243 && absY <= 3259) { return true; } else { return false; } }

Read full topic

item.title: Need help once more
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

I think you need to make a void for it or something… like take a look at resetdrop for example:

if(command.startsWith("resetdrop")) { ItemHandler.resetItemDrop(); c.yell("["+c.playerName+"] - turned on drops."); }

Read full topic

item.title: Need help once more
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

Oh ok, i don’t know then :L

Read full topic

item.title: Need help once more
item.dc:creator: @Ill_Pk_You Ill Pk You
item.description:
@Ill_Pk_You wrote:

No, it is admin rights. “>” is more than. But if it was “>=” it would be equal to mod rights or over.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help once more
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

It ws allrady mod right (1) i was saying turning it to 0?

if(command.startsWith(“onfunpk”) && (connectedFrom.equals(“localhost”) || playerRights > 1)) {
FunPk = true;
sM(“You turned on Fun Pk.”);
yell("["+playerName+"] - turned on FunPk Pking (::offfunpk and ::onfunpk for admins).");
}
if(command.startsWith(“offfunpk”) && (connectedFrom.equals(“localhost”) || playerRights > 1)) {
FunPk = false;
sM(“You turned off Fun Pk.”);
yell("["+playerName+"] - turned off FunPk Pking (::offfunpk and ::onfunpk for admins).");
}

to

if(command.startsWith(“onfunpk”) && (connectedFrom.equals(“localhost”) || playerRights > 1)) {
FunPk = true;
sM(“You turned on Fun Pk.”);
yell("["+playerName+"] - turned on FunPk Pking (::offfunpk and ::onfunpk for admins).");
}
if(command.startsWith(“offfunpk”) && (connectedFrom.equals(“localhost”) || playerRights > 0)) {
FunPk = false;
sM(“You turned off Fun Pk.”);
yell("["+playerName+"] - turned off FunPk Pking (::offfunpk and ::onfunpk for admins).");
}

Read full topic

item.title: Need help once more
item.dc:creator: @Ill_Pk_You Ill Pk You
item.description:
@Ill_Pk_You wrote:

No, I want it so only admins or higher staff position can change the status of it being off or on. I don’t think that it would make a difference changing it from admin rights to mod rights?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help once more
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

if(command.startsWith(“offfunpk”) && (connectedFrom.equals(“localhost”) || playerRights > 1)) {
to
if(command.startsWith(“offfunpk”) && (connectedFrom.equals(“localhost”) || playerRights > 0)) {

From what im understanding, the funpk only comes off with people above mod?

So changing it fro 1 - 0 , work for everyone?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help once more
item.dc:creator: @Ill_Pk_You Ill Pk You
item.description:
@Ill_Pk_You wrote:

if(command.startsWith("onfunpk") && (connectedFrom.equals("localhost") || playerRights > 1)) { FunPk = true; sM("You turned on Fun Pk."); yell("["+playerName+"] - turned on FunPk Pking (::offfunpk and ::onfunpk for admins)."); } if(command.startsWith("offfunpk") && (connectedFrom.equals("localhost") || playerRights > 1)) { FunPk = false; sM("You turned off Fun Pk."); yell("["+playerName+"] - turned off FunPk Pking (::offfunpk and ::onfunpk for admins)."); }

Theres both the turning it off and turning it back on. Btw, I have already declared the “Fun Pk = true” boolean.

Read full topic
